intro: Agelaea emetica, commonly known as the vomit plant, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and woody stems. The plant is notable for its toxic properties, containing compounds that can induce vomiting and other gastrointestinal distress. It is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and forest edges. Due to its toxic nature, it is typically avoided by both livestock and humans.
